alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 2:54PM CDT until May 30 at 9:28AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...In the Texas Panhandle, southern Deaf Smith County. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM CDT, emergency management reported that Highway 385 was closed at Tierra Blanca Creek in Hereford and flooding was affecting many buildings, including 88 homes. 4 to 7 inches of rainfall fell late Friday night around and upstream of Hereford. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Frio Draw and Tierra Blanca Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hereford and Bootleg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
